classDescription: A project-focused course introducing students to 3D modeling, lighting, animation principles, and production workflows. Students will work with industry-grade tools to build assets and short animated sequences.

teacher.name: Alice Johnson
teacher.bio: Alexandra is a senior 3D artist with over 10 years of experience in game cinematics and animated commercial productions. She specializes in character modeling, stylized rendering, and animation pipelines.

syllabus:
Welcome to 3D Graphics & Animation!

This course covers modeling fundamentals, UV unwrapping, texturing, lighting, character animation, and rendering workflows. Throughout the semester, students will complete hands-on projects aimed at building a small but polished animation portfolio.

Topics include:
• 3D space navigation & topology rules
• Subdivision modeling & clean geometry
• PBR texturing and material workflows
• Lighting with realism & style
• Keyframing, easing, and motion principles
• Rendering optimization and compositing

Students are expected to complete weekly assignments and participate in critique sessions.
